page.title: 11FARMING IN THE WEDMORE AREA
page.content: Most farms are run by the family and only a few employ labourers who live in cottages owned by the farmers. The working day is roughly 10 hours for the family farm worker but is often much more especially during harvest. The main crops are grass, silage and hay.Smaller crops include maize,barley wheat,fodder beet and turnips. Apples, in small orchards are common as they are used for{cider making. There is one farm making cider in Cocklake. It employs 6 people during the processing of cider. The machines used are all over 100 years old and make the cider in the traditional way. Farmers own much of the machinery needed with 2 to 5 tractors per farm. However silage making and some hay bailing is principally done by one main contractor in the area.
